news.title: Mumbai: Govandi housing society residents want fume-emitting concrete plant relocated
news.para: In a letter to the municipal ward officer sent last week the residents have said that the particulate emissions from the plant are degrading the air quality apart from it residents have to put up with constant noise pollution throughout the day as trucks keep moving inside out.

news.title: Delhi HC expresses concern over newly built houses for EWS lying vacant
news.para: ​The high court took suo moto cognisance of the situation and said it was of the opinion that the process of completion of these houses ought to proceed expeditiously so that the slum dwellers in the city can be duly rehabilitated and can be offered these flats as per the policy framed.

news.title: Nagpur: Three-year jail to engineer-cum-builder for consumer forum contempt
news.para: While issuing a conviction warrant against Anil Potdukhe, who is also a planner, designer and an estimator, a bench comprising president Sanjay Patil and members Smita Chandekar and Avinash Prabhune directed him to pay Rs25,000 fine and Rs15,000 to the complainant towards the litigation cost.

news.title: Chandigarh housing board committee recommends one-time settlement scheme
news.para: Sources said panel members suggested for one-time settlement scheme for the building violation cases, and also to allow construction up to 75% area of the courtyard instead of existing 50% in different category of CHB flats.

news.title: Individual housing loan cap for cooperative lenders doubled
news.para: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das announced that urban cooperative banks will now be allowed to lend up to Rs 1.40 crore as against the previous cap of Rs 70 lakh, while rural cooperative banks can now lend up to Rs 75 lakh as against earlier cap of Rs 30 lakh.

news.title: Bombay HC seeks data on illegal constructions razed in two years in Vasai-Virar
news.para: Advocate Ajay Jaiswal, for a petitioner, informed Chief Justice Dipankar Datta and Justice Makarand Karnik that VMMC is not following a May 2018 GR that directed all civic bodies to file caveat before the civil court as soon as demolition order is passed.

news.title: Reserve Bank of India hikes rates by 50 basis points
news.para: The central bank also dropped the long-standing phrase that future policy would remain 'accommodative', reinforcing expectations of further rate hikes and other forms of tightening in coming months as fighting inflation becomes its main focus.

news.title: Transit-oriented East Delhi hub to be ready by October 2024
news.para: Developed on around 63 acres of land, the project will have about 15 million sq ft of built-up area with 30 residential and commercial towers around Delhi Metro’s Pink and Blue Line corridors.

news.title: Madurai corporation orders demolition of 571 buildings
news.para: The civic body ordered for an enumeration of such old buildings in the city limits. The enumeration found 99 buildings in zone 1, 148 in zone 2, 104 in zone 3, 220 in zone 4 of the corporation.

news.title: HDFC Bank hikes lending rates by 0.35%; second hike in two months
news.para: The RBI had surprised all with a 0.40 per cent hike in key interest rates on May 4 to tame the inflation situation and is widely expected to follow up with further tightening of the policy on Wednesday.

news.title: Bengaluru civic body's property tax portal causes anxiety among netizens
news.para: But this is an unnecessary effort for the citizens. I went to the BBMP office and got it rectified and need to check if I can make the payments now. I know multiple people from Mahadevapura who are facing the same issue,” he said.

news.title: Telangana SCDRC orders Emaar to refund buyer's advance with compensation
news.para: One Alphonse Reddy Chintalavheruvu of Madanapalle, Chittoor district in Andhra Pradesh, filed a petition against AP Industrial Infrastructure Corporation Limited (APIIC), Emaar Hills Township Private Limited and Emaar MGF Limited.

news.title: Gurugram: Only plotted areas, not highrises, in private colonies to be taken over
news.para: According to an MCG official, the proposed takeover is only for plotted areas as colonies and group housing societies (highrises) are governed by different norms.

news.title: HC asks Haryana, Punjab & UT if state-developed projects can be under RERA
news.para: ​HC has passed these orders while observing that several cases being filed by the people from these states conveyed their grouse against the non-fulfilment of promises made by the state agencies in developing various housing projects.

news.title: Noida: Tentative date for Supertech twin towers demolition moved to Aug 21
news.para: The Supreme Court had earlier permitted extending the demolition date till August 28 from May 22 this year after the private company engaged for the work approached it with a plea for time extension.
